title: Congaree National Park: Park Home
body: Home of Champions  Astonishing biodiversity exists in Congaree National Park, the largest intact expanse of old growth bottomland hardwood forest remaining in the southeastern United States.Â   Waters from the Congaree and Wateree Rivers sweep through the floodplain, carrying nutrients and sediments that nourish and rejuvenate this ecosystem and support the growth of national and state champion trees.              Plan Your Visit to Congaree   There is so much to do at Congaree National Park! Canoeing, hiking, fishing, camping are just some of your many options.
